item.title: 股市牛市继续前进，问题是何时遇到熊市
item.description: 股市正在升温。在连续九个交易日上涨并在此期间累计上涨 10%之后，S&P 500 指数以 20 多年来最长的连涨走势结束了本周的交易，收复了自 4 月 2 日唐纳德-特朗普总统发动全球贸易战以来的全部损失。【原文：The stock market is on a heater. After rising for nine straight sessions and gaining 10% in that time, the S&P 500 Index closed out the week on its longest winning streak in more than 20 years, recouping all of its losses since April 2, when President Donald Trump launched his global trade war.】

item.title: 刚果授权马斯克的 "星链 "服务在该国运营
item.description: 刚果民主共和国将允许埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的 "星链"（Starlink）卫星互联网服务在该国运营，这是在与美国就 "矿产换安全 "伙伴关系进行谈判之际的一项政策变化。【原文：The Democratic Republic of Congo will allow Elon Musk’s Starlink satellite internet service to operate in the country, a change in policy amid talks with the US about a minerals-for-security partnership.】

item.title: 尼日利亚为清理储备造成 90 亿美元衍生品损失
item.description: 尼日利亚央行试图削减其资产负债表上的外汇负债，并恢复投资者对支持奈拉的现有措施的信心，因此在 2024 年结算逾期衍生品合约时出现了 13.9 万亿奈拉（约合 90 亿美元）的损失。【原文：The Nigerian central bank had a 13.9 trillion naira ($9 billion) loss on the settlement of overdue derivatives contracts in 2024 as it tried to prune foreign currency liabilities on its balance sheet and restore investor confidence on available measures to support the naira.】

item.title: 中国采取行动应对贝森特的包围计划
item.description: 在地缘经济战略方面，习近平主席的政府正显示出日益成熟的迹象。为了避免在全球贸易体系中被白宫孤立，中国政府想出了一些新招数。【原文：President Xi Jinping’s government is showing signs of increased sophistication when it comes to geo-economic strategy. In an effort to avoid isolation by the White House in the global trading system, Beijing has come up with some new tricks.】

item.title: 与会代表称欧佩克+同意 6 月石油供应再次激增
item.description: 据与会代表称，欧佩克+同意在 6 月份再次增产，这可能会加深原油价格的跌势。【原文：OPEC+ agreed to make another production surge in June, according to delegates, potentially deepening the slump in crude prices.】

item.title: 全球工厂努力克服特朗普关税和不确定性
item.description: 在本周的一系列报道中，有更多迹象表明，唐纳德-特朗普总统的贸易战正在影响全球制造业。【原文：More signs emerged in a wave of reports this week that global manufacturing is buckling from President Donald Trump’s trade war.】

item.title: 全球经济图表：美国在国内生产总值下降后仍保持强劲招聘势头
item.description: 美国 4 月份的就业增长依然稳健，表明劳动力需求健康，进入了关税更有可能抑制招聘决策的时期。【原文：US job growth remained solid in April, illustrating healthy labor demand entering a period when tariffs have a greater risk of tempering hiring decisions.】

item.title: 印度最大银行计划出售股票筹资 30 亿美元
item.description: 印度国家银行计划在本财年通过新股融资 2,500 亿卢比（约合 30 亿美元），这是这家国有贷款机构七年来首次进行股权融资。【原文：State Bank of India plans to raise 250 billion rupees ($3 billion) through new shares and this fiscal year, marking the first equity raising by the state lender in seven years.】

item.description: 在过去几年中，美国两党都逐渐放弃了对经济的自由放任思想，而更倾向于国家在塑造市场中发挥积极作用的观点。共和党人谈论更严格的反垄断和主权财富基金，民主党人当然也支持在关键战略领域实施产业政策。但如何设计好市场？何时会失败？在美国，这类事情的历史又是怎样的？在美国【原文：Over the last several years, both parties in the US have been drifting away from laissez-faire thinking about the economy, and more towards the view that the state has an active role in shaping markets. But how do you design markets well? When does it fail? And what is the history of this type of thing in the US. In t】

item.title: 海湾国家将在数周内达成 60 亿美元的非洲能源交易
item.description: 最近几周，中东国家对至少 60 亿美元的非洲能源资产表现出了兴趣或完成了交易，这表明该地区对非洲大陆的投资欲望有所增强。【原文：Middle East countries have shown interest in or completed deals for at least $6 billion of African energy assets in recent weeks, demonstrating a larger investment appetite on the continent by the region.】

item.title: 印度禁止从巴基斯坦进口，针锋相对的措施不断扩大
item.description: 在上个月发生致命恐怖袭击事件后，两个有核国家之间的紧张局势升级，印度禁止进口所有来自巴基斯坦或从巴基斯坦过境的货物。【原文：India banned the import of all goods originating from or transiting through Pakistan as tensions between the two nuclear-armed nations escalate in the wake of a deadly terror attack last month.】

item.title: RTS 称塞尔维亚总统武契奇因健康原因缩短访美行程
item.description: 据塞尔维亚国家广播公司（RTS）报道，塞尔维亚总统亚历山大-武契奇周五在佛罗里达州时突然生病，他将回国，取消原计划在美国举行的会议。【原文：Serbian President Aleksandar Vucic suddenly fell sick while in Florida on Friday and will return home, canceling his planned meetings in the US, state broadcaster RTS reported.】

item.title: 即使选择退出，谷歌也能利用网页内容训练搜索人工智能
item.description: 谷歌公司产品副总裁周五在法庭上作证称，即使出版商选择不接受谷歌人工智能产品的训练，谷歌也可以在全网内容上训练其搜索专用的人工智能产品，如人工智能概述。【原文：Google can train its search-specific AI products, like AI Overviews, on content across the web even when the publishers have chosen to opt out of training Google’s AI products, a vice-president of product at the company testified in court on Friday.】

item.title: 香港自 2020 年以来首次买入美元以维持外汇联系汇率制
item.description: 香港金融管理局买入美元以限制该市货币的涨幅，这是自 2020 年以来首次进行此类干预。【原文：The Hong Kong Monetary Authority bought US dollars to cap the gains of the city’s currency, the first such intervention since 2020.】

item.title: 欧佩克+决定出台前，大型石油公司拒绝减产
item.description: 尽管 4 月份原油价格下跌了 16%，而且欧佩克+可能进一步增产，但西方最大的石油生产国目前大多仍坚持其增长计划。【原文：The largest western oil producers are mostly sticking with their growth plans for now, despite a 16% decline in crude prices during April and the potential for further increases in output from OPEC+.】

item.title: 美联储主要监管官员将于年底离职
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，美联储监督和监管部主任迈克尔-吉布森（Michael Gibson）将于今年年底离职，此前他已在美国中央银行工作了三十多年。【原文：Michael Gibson, director of the Federal Reserve’s supervision and regulation division, will leave at the end of the year following more than three decades at the US central bank, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 华尔街史诗般卷土重来，市场未解之谜层出不穷
item.description: 这是华尔街重振雄风的一周。股市上演了一出万有引力的反弹，抹平了四月关税冲击带来的所有损失，美国企业释放了数十亿压抑已久的债券销售，从加密货币到无利可图的科技公司等投机资产飙升。【原文：It was the week Wall Street got its swagger back. Stocks staged a gravity-defying rebound to wipe out all losses from April’s tariff shock, Corporate America unleashed billions in pent-up bond sales and speculative assets from crypto to unprofitable tech companies surged.】

item.title: I Squared 即将就价值 50 亿美元的马特宏峰管道达成协议
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，以 I Squared Capital 为首的一个财团正在考虑收购 Matterhorn Express 管道公司，包括债务在内，该德克萨斯州天然气管道公司的估值约为 50 亿美元。【原文：A consortium led by I Squared Capital is considering buying Matterhorn Express Pipeline in a deal that would value the Texas natural gas conduit at about $5 billion including debt, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 美国指定破坏海地稳定的帮派为恐怖组织
item.description: 美国将两个强大的海地帮派认定为 "外国恐怖组织"，指责它们破坏国家稳定并威胁美国利益，从而加大了对控制该国大部分贸易的这两个帮派的压力。【原文：The US designated two powerful Haitian gangs it accused of destabilizing the country and threatening US interests as “Foreign Terrorist Organizations,” escalating pressure on the groups that control much of the country’s trade.】

item.title: 美国以雅虎日本交易为由要求谷歌共享数据
item.description: 美国反垄断执法人员追溯到谷歌 15 年前达成的一项协议，认为 Alphabet 公司旗下的谷歌应该再次与第三方共享信息，这一次是为了结束其对在线搜索的非法垄断。【原文：US antitrust enforcers reached back to a deal Google struck 15 years ago to argue that the Alphabet Inc. unit should once again share information with third parties, this time to end its illegal monopoly of online search.】

item.title: 摩根大通的斯彭斯规划了一条通往 1 万亿美元 ETF 资产的道路
item.description:
JPMAM的ETF全球主管特拉维斯-斯彭斯（Travis Spence）认为，未来五年公司的ETF资产将达到这一里程碑。【原文：

item.title: 马莎百货遭黑客攻击后，英国要求企业 "清醒 "过来
item.description: 在包括 Marks & Spencer Group Plc 在内的零售商接连受到攻击后，英国一位高级大臣下周将警告企业保护自己免受网络威胁。【原文：A senior UK minister next week will warn businesses to protect themselves against cyber threats after a spate of attacks on retailers including Marks & Spencer Group Plc.】

item.title: 小型物流公司因计划购买特朗普纪念币而股价大涨
item.description: 一家小型物流公司计划将唐纳德-特朗普总统的memecoin作为国库资产持有，这推动了该公司股价大涨。【原文：A small logistics company’s plan to hold President Donald Trump’s memecoin as a treasury asset is fueling its blistering stock rally.】
